item.title: An Act to provide for reconciliation pursuant to titles II and V of the concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 2018.
Systemic Risk Designation Improvement Act of 2017

latestAction.text: Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

item.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 233 - 193 (Roll no. 689). (text: CR H10189-10190)
Passed/agreed to in House: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 233 - 193 (Roll no. 689).(text: CR H10189-10190)
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 233 - 187 (Roll no. 688).
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 667.
Considered as privileged matter. (consideration: CR H10189-10200)

The resolution provides for consideration of the conference report to accompany H.R. 1. Additionally, the resolution provides for consideration of H.R. 3312, under a closed rule. The rule provides for one hour of general debate and one motion to recommit on both the conference report and H.R. 3312. Lastly, the rule provides for motions to suspend the rules through the remainder of the first session of the 115th Congress.
Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 111.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 115-474, by Mr. Sessions.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 115-474, by Mr. Sessions.

summary.text: Sets forth the rule for consideration of the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 1) to provide for reconciliation pursuant to titles II and V of the concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 2018; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3312) to amend the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act to specify when bank holding companies may be subject to certain enhanced supervision, and for other purposes.

bill.title: Providing for consideration of the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 1) to provide for reconciliation pursuant to titles II and V of the concurrent resolution on the budget for fiscal year 2018; providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 3312) to amend the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act to specify when bank holding companies may be subject to certain enhanced supervision, and for other purposes; and for other purposes.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
